findings.title: Confidentiality may be perpetual / indefinite
findings.rationale: Indefinite confidentiality can create long-term compliance burden and uncertainty around retention and disclosure.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...7. CONFIDENTIALITY Confidentiality obligations survive termination indefinitely....
findings.exact_snippet: CONFIDENTIALITY Confidentiality obligations survive termination indefinitely
findings.context:
s limited to the amount paid in the 12 months preceding the claim, except for gross negligence or willful misconduct.

6. TERM AND TERMINATION
Either party may terminate immediately upon material breach.

7. CONFIDENTIALITY
Confidentiality obligations survive termination indefinitely.

8. WARRANTIES
Provider disclaims all warranties except as expressly stated herein.

9. DISPUTE RESOLUTION
Disputes shall be resolved through mediation, then arbitration if mediation fails.

findings.title: Specific governing law or venue
findings.rationale: Governing law and venue choices can affect enforcement cost and strategy.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...10. GOVERNING LAW This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of New York....
findings.context:
r disclaims all warranties except as expressly stated herein.

9. DISPUTE RESOLUTION
Disputes shall be resolved through mediation, then arbitration if mediation fails.

10. GOVERNING LAW
This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of New York.

11. ATTORNEYS' FEES
Each party shall bear its own attorneys' fees.

12. MODIFICATIONS
This Agreement may only be modified in writing signed by both parties.

findings.title: Late fees / high interest
findings.rationale: Penalty terms can increase costs if payment timing slips.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...2. PAYMENT TERMS Payment is due within 15 days. Late payments incur a 2% monthly fee....
findings.context:
rvice Provider ("Provider") and Client Company ("Client").

1. SERVICES
Provider agrees to provide the services described in attached Statements of Work.

2. PAYMENT TERMS
Payment is due within 15 days. Late payments incur a 2% monthly fee.

3. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
Provider retains ownership of pre-existing intellectual property. Client receives a non-exclusive license to use deliverables.

4. INDEMNIFICATION
Each party

changes: Added 8 high-signal rules (attorneys fees, liability cap carveouts, assignment restrictions, etc.)
Implemented clause-level anchoring and false-positive suppression
